single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.BAC_injection module¶

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.BAC_injection.BAC_injection(cell, dist=None)[source]¶

This injects the BAC stimulus as defined in Hay et. al. 2011 at a specified distance.

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.apical_epsp_injection module¶

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.apical_epsp_injection.apical_epsp_injection(cell, dist=None, amplitude=None, delay=None, rise=1.0, decay=5)[source]¶

This injects epsp shaped current at a certain distance from the soma.

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.scale_apical module¶

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.scale_apical.scale_apical(cell, scale=None, compartment='ApicalDendrite')[source]¶

This is the function used to scale the apical dendrite in the following optimizations:

20190117_fitting_CDK_morphologies_Kv3_1_slope_variable_dend_scale.ipynb 20190125_fitting_CDK_morphologies_Kv3_1_slope_variable_dend_scale_step.ipynb

scale apical diameters depending on distance to soma; therefore only possible after creating complete cell

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.scale_apical_morph_86 module¶

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.scale_apical_morph_86.scale_apical_morph_86(cell)[source]¶

This is the method, robert has used for scaling the apical dendrite of CDK morphology 86

scale apical diameters depending on distance to soma; therefore only possible after creating complete cell

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.synaptic_input module¶

Module contents¶

Created on Feb 16, 2019

@author: abast

This package is contains functions, that modify the cell after it is initalized.

Such a function can for example be used to scale the apical dendrite.

These kind of modifying functions have caused a lot of trouble in the past, as it has not been specified in the neuron parameterfile. No record of whether a modification had been applied was saved alongside the simulation data.

Now, the cell parameter file can contain the key “cell_modify_functions” in its neuron section. The value corresponding to that key is a dictionary. The keys of that dictionary can be names to modules in this package. The values corresponding to these keys are the keyword arguments of the respective cell modify function.

I.e.

{‘neuron’: {

‘Soma’: { … } ‘Dendrite’: { … } ‘filename’: {some hocpath} ‘cell_modify_functions’: {

‘scale_apical’: {‘scale’: 2.1}

}}}

single_cell_parser.cell_modify_functions.get(funname)[source]¶
